chunks.original_text: 太上慈悲道场消灾九幽忏卷之八竟 太上慈悲道场消灾九幽忏卷之九 太极左仙公葛玄纂集 为国祈求品第一 今日道场大众，人各运心，仰对慈尊，当示一切众生演说，为国为家，祈求恩福。 忏主某长跪接手，谛听经言，若以国主有灾，星宿失度，兵革四兴，风雨不调，百谷不成，兆民疾疫，国土不安，兴师动众，有所施为，种种灾厄，一切不祥，皆当告我。 造大功德，抄经写像，置观度人，复以帑藏、珍宝玩具、金银珠玉、珊瑚琥珀、宫苑彩素及以田园屋宅，将用布施，入三宝福田，度脱众生，救拔危苦，释解囚徒，建诸斋戒，敷百高座，演说大乘甚深妙义，劝诱国人皆令听法，布施忏悔，救护功德，不可思议。 若复帝主臣僚，纵恣暴怒，多行邪欲，杀戮无度，自取逍遥，苦虐一切，致有灾厄，临於兆庶，日月失昏，灾星傍照，侵逼帝座，国多水旱，妖怪虫蝗，人民叛乱，僭佞互起。 无奈何者，而以帝主人王，及天下人民，当召三洞法身，及以坛众，无限其数，遍诣灵坛宫观、山水岩洞、圣迹之所，广建道场，悬诸旛盖，散花、烧香、然灯，日夜行道，礼忏无倦，六时殷勤，不息广施财宝，救拯一切，吾即以道力，作大神通，助其消却，令被灾害，应时灭溃。 若有国分，五星失正，暗曜差移，二十八宿，不依分野，日月勃蚀，阴阳不调，当使南上司命韩君丈人，周天八极长生司马，调理璇玑，复於分位，灾祥变异，皆使消灭。 若复大旱，人民渴乏，即以龙王震雷霍雨，以灭旱苦。 若或大雨霪澍，洪水滔天，连阴不解，人民浛没，即以河上玉女、九海北玄君、正炁君吏，为收水炁，开云止雨，水即消退，无所损伤。 时诸龙鬼，亦各念善。 若有外魔，邪精恶鬼，魑魅魍魉，入其境土，欲行病苦，当共斥逐，不使留停。 是我慈尊，威德至重，克使皇图永固，帝德长新。 跻民於仁寿之庭，措国於华胥之域。 阴阳交泰，日月长明，寰海晏清，臣民康乐，三边宁静，五谷丰秾。 普济言，天下人民，分其贫富、贵贱不同，纵使修行，必不能辨，唯行一事。 复虑未免灾危，进退疑惑，莫能明了。 未审救护功德，有等差否？ 慈尊言，救护解厄，本在至诚，布施舍财，不以多少。 凡有五种：一者造我形像，真应化身。 福流历劫，果报无穷。 何以故？ 众生妄想，心不可系，睹我真容，便生念想，念想既生，真灵降接，专怀注想，克果无为； 二者抄写经教，三洞大乘。 福流永劫，功德无边。 是故经者，导引愚迷，能发众生无量道意，从迷起悟，从悟成真，众圣修行，皆登道果； 三者置观度人，立造堂殿。 功德无量，不可思议。 何以故？

**First Chapter: Praying for the State**

Today, the assembly of this Daoist ritual, each with focused mind, gazes reverently toward the Compassionate Honored One. May you expound for all beings, teaching them to pray for the state and their households, seeking grace and blessings.

The repentant patron [Name], kneeling with hands clasped, listens attentively to the scriptural words. If the sovereign faces calamity—celestial bodies losing their course, wars erupting on all sides, winds and rains unbalanced, the hundred grains failing to ripen, the people stricken by plague, the land unsettled, armies mobilized for campaigns, or any manner of disasters and inauspicious omens—all must be reported to me.

Great merits shall be cultivated: transcribing scriptures and commissioning sacred images, establishing temples to deliver beings, and offering from the treasury precious treasures, jewels, gold, silver, pearls, coral, amber, palace gardens, silken banners, fields, gardens, and dwellings. These shall be dedicated as alms, sown into the field of the Three Treasures, to deliver sentient beings, rescue those in peril, release prisoners, establish fasts and precepts, arrange hundreds of high seats, and expound the profound and wondrous teachings of the Great Vehicle. Thus shall the people of the realm be exhorted to listen to the Dharma, practice almsgiving and repentance, and accumulate boundless, inconceivable merits of salvation and protection.

If the sovereign and ministers indulge in wrath, pursue depravity, slaughter without restraint, seek self-indulgence, and oppress all beings, bringing forth calamities upon the people—where sun and moon lose their brightness, baleful stars encroach upon the imperial throne, the land suffers floods and droughts, omens and locusts appear, the people rebel, and usurpers rise—then the sovereign and all under heaven must summon the Three Caverns’ Dharma Bodies and the assembly of the altar, countless in number, to fill sacred altars, temples, mountains, waters, grottoes, and holy sites. There, grand rituals shall be established, banners and canopies hung, flowers scattered, incense burned, lamps lit, the Dao practiced day and night, repentance offered without weariness, and the six periods observed with diligence. Treasures shall be widely dispensed to rescue all beings. Then, by my Dao-power, I shall manifest great divine transformations to assist in dispelling these disasters, causing the afflictions to dissolve at once.

If within the realm the Five Stars lose their proper course, dim luminaries stray, the Twenty-Eight Constellations deviate from their domains, sun and moon suffer eclipses, and yin and yang fall out of harmony, then the Southern Director of Destinies, Lord Han the Venerable, and the Controller of the Eight Directions of the Celestial Sphere, Sima the Longevous, shall regulate the celestial mechanism, restoring them to their rightful positions, and all calamitous omens shall be extinguished.

If great drought leaves the people parched and suffering, then the Dragon Kings shall shake thunder and summon torrential rains to end the drought’s hardship. If heavy rains pour unceasingly, floods surge to the heavens, and the people drown, then the Jade Maiden of the River, the Dark Lord of the Nine Seas, and the Officers of the True Qi shall gather the water-qi, part the clouds, and halt the rain, causing the waters to recede without harm. At this time, all dragon-spirits and ghosts shall likewise turn toward goodness.

If external demons, evil spirits, or malevolent ghosts—*chimei* and *wangliang*—enter the land to spread sickness and suffering, they shall be expelled together, allowed no respite. By the weight of my compassion and virtue, the imperial domain shall be eternally secured, the sovereign’s power ever renewed. The people shall ascend to the court of benevolence and longevity, the state placed within the realm of Huaxu. Yin and yang shall harmonize, sun and moon shine eternally, the seas and lands know peace, ministers and people enjoy well-being, the three frontiers remain tranquil, and the five grains flourish abundantly.

Yet, among the people of the world, though their wealth, status, and conditions differ, even if they cultivate the Dao, they may not discern the proper path. They may perform deeds yet remain beset by calamities, wavering in doubt, unable to attain clarity. They wonder: does the merit of salvation and protection vary in degree?

The Compassionate Honored One replied: Salvation and deliverance from distress depend upon utmost sincerity; the almsgiving of wealth is not measured by quantity. There are five kinds of merit:

First, the creation of my sacred images—true, responsive, and transformative manifestations. Blessings shall flow across kalpas, and retribution shall be boundless. Why? Because sentient beings, lost in delusion, cannot fix their minds. Beholding my true form, they generate devotion. With devotion arisen, true numen descends to meet them. Focused and unwavering, they attain the fruit of non-action.

Second, the transcription of scriptural teachings—the Great Vehicle of the Three Caverns. Blessings shall flow eternally, and merits shall be immeasurable. For scriptures guide the deluded, awakening boundless Dao-mind in beings, leading them from confusion to enlightenment, from enlightenment to truth. All sages who cultivate the Dao ascend to its fruition.

Third, the establishment of temples to deliver beings, the construction of halls and sanctuaries. The merit is boundless, inconceivable. Why?

chunks.original_text: 度人出家住持，经像教化众生，令发道心，一以悟万，轮转因缘，助国化人，弘道明法，利益最多； 四者修斋行道，礼忏诵经。 赞叹烧香，福田无量。 是故斋以洗心，道能通悟，行道谢罪，礼忏祈恩，功感诸天，消灾降福，生死受赖； 五者布施一切，无量福田。 果报巍巍，其功深厚。 财物者，众生性命，切己难忘，能舍命财，心不吝惜，广建功德，普济众生，内息悭贪，外除劫贼，生死蒙恩，人天利益。 如是作福五种法门，皆随力分，以渐修行，保国安家，超生拔苦。 经言犹如甘雨一澍，受者皆润。 随其禀识，悉得滋荣，礼忏求悔，亦复如是。 今日道场大众，闻经所言，能劝众生立诸功德，不可思议。 忏主某自从无量劫来，至于今日，未曾闻诸功德，引喻法门。 今日伏为平安　追荐礼此忏文，获大悟解，五体投地，一心谛听。 稽首慈尊，敬礼真圣。 志心敬礼，玉清降福天尊。 志心敬礼，寻声救苦天尊。 志心敬礼，玉虚明皇天尊。 志心敬礼，太极真容天尊。 志心敬礼，真一自然天尊。 志心敬礼，皆受记天尊。 志心敬礼，化气天尊。 志心敬礼，龙德天尊。 志心敬礼，胜相天尊。 志心敬礼，高德天尊。 志心敬礼，太玄天尊。 志心敬礼，乐游天尊。 志心敬礼，八极天尊。 志心敬礼，知真天尊。 志心敬礼，五气天尊。 志心敬礼，太虚天尊。 志心敬礼，清虚天尊。 志心敬礼，金容天尊。 志心敬礼，感降天尊。 志心敬礼，玉京天尊。 志心敬礼，保应天尊。 志心敬礼，太一救苦天尊。 志心敬礼，长生保命天尊。 志心敬礼，普慈护国天尊。 志心敬礼，逍遥快乐天尊。 志心敬礼，随愿往生天尊。 志心敬礼，无边际天尊。 志心敬礼，功德海天尊。 志心敬礼，宝相真人。 志心敬礼，圆寂真人。 志心敬礼，大慈救苦真人。 志心敬礼，大悲拔罪真人。 今日道场忏主，及以大众，归命归依，仰愿上方无上灵宝天尊、诸尊诸圣、诸大天仙、诸大洞天仙众、地仙、水仙、飞仙，普济真人，救苦真人，救苦童子，遍十方际、尽玄虚界、隐显一切真圣。 广覆玄恩，遍流国土。 愿以帝王，景祚延永，烽燧不生，戈鋋偃戢，疆土守界，诸王太子，共肥帝业，臣子忠正，辅弼卿相，与国同休，共匡宇宙。 愿以乾坤明素，气象清玄，水旱长蠲，虫蝗不起，三边永息，灾疠沈潜，风雨顺时，稼穑稔岁，天垂甘露，地涌祥云，国富臣贤，家足孝悌。 次愿罗山诸狱，八难九幽，罢考神魂，长空三恶。 忏主某自从无量无始劫来，至于今劫今生，今日九祖父母、一切眷属，愿承礼忏力、功德力。 咸得超升，归正真道。 一拜
chunks.translated_text:
Third, the deliverance of beings through monastic ordination and temple stewardship, the propagation of scriptures and icons to teach and transform sentient beings, inspiring them to awaken the Dao-mind—one realization opening myriad gates. Through the turning of karmic conditions, they aid the nation and transform the people, spreading the Dao and illuminating the Dharma, yielding the greatest benefit.

Fourth, the observance of purification rites and the practice of the Dao, the performance of repentance and the recitation of scriptures, the offering of praise and the burning of incense. The field of merit is boundless. Thus, purification rites cleanse the heart, the Dao enables penetrating insight, the practice of the Dao atones for transgressions, repentance invokes blessings, and the resonance of merit moves the heavens, dispelling calamities and bestowing fortune, upon which both life and death depend.

Fifth, the bestowal of all things in boundless fields of merit. The karmic retribution is towering, its merit profound and deep. Wealth and possessions are the lifeblood of sentient beings, clung to as if one’s own life, yet to relinquish them without hesitation, to give without stinginess, is to broadly establish merit, universally succoring sentient beings, inwardly stilling greed and avarice, outwardly eliminating plunder and theft. In life and death, they receive grace, and both humans and heavens reap the benefit.

These five Dharma-gates of merit-making are to be cultivated gradually according to one’s capacity, safeguarding the nation and securing the household, transcending rebirth and delivering from suffering. As the scriptures say, it is like a single sweet rain—all who receive it are nourished. According to their innate faculties, each attains flourishing growth. So too is the performance of repentance and the seeking of forgiveness.

Today, the assembly of this Dao-field, having heard the scriptural teachings, exhorts sentient beings to establish these inconceivable merits. The repentant one, so-and-so, from kalpas without beginning until this very kalpa and this present life, has never before encountered such merit or the analogies of these Dharma-gates. Today, prostrating for peace and offering this repentance text in ancestral veneration, they attain great awakening and understanding, bowing with utmost reverence, listening with single-minded devotion.

With bowed heads, they pay homage to the Merciful Venerable One, reverently saluting the true sages:
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Jade Purity Heavenly Worthy, Bestower of Fortune.

With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Heavenly Worthy of Pure Emptiness.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Heavenly Worthy of Golden Countenance.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Heavenly Worthy Who Responds to Devotion.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Capital.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Heavenly Worthy Who Protects and Responds.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Heavenly Worthy of the Great One Who Rescues from Suffering.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Heavenly Worthy Who Preserves Life and Protects Destiny.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Heavenly Worthy of Universal Compassion Who Guards the Nation.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Heavenly Worthy of Carefree Joy.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Heavenly Worthy Who Grants Rebirth According to Wishes.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Boundless Heavenly Worthy.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Heavenly Worthy of the Ocean of Merit.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Perfected One of Precious Countenance.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Perfected One of Perfect Quiescence.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Perfected One of Great Compassion Who Rescues from Suffering.
With devoted heart, they reverently salute the Perfected One of Great Compassion Who Eradicates Transgressions.

Today, the repentant one of this Dao-field, together with the great assembly, surrenders and takes refuge, reverently beseeching the Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Upper Realm, all the Venerables and Sages, all the Great Heavenly Immortals, all the Immortals of the Great Grotto-Heavens, Earth Immortals, Water Immortals, Flying Immortals, Perfected Ones of Universal Salvation, Perfected Ones Who Rescue from Suffering, Youths Who Rescue from Suffering, and all true sages throughout the ten directions, the farthest reaches of the mysterious void, and all realms manifest and hidden.

May their vast and mysterious grace universally flow through the land. May the emperor’s reign be eternally prolonged, the beacon fires of war unlit, weapons stilled and sheathed, borders secured and frontiers guarded. May the imperial princes and heirs together strengthen the imperial enterprise, ministers and officials loyal and upright, assisting counselors and chancellors sharing the nation’s prosperity, jointly upholding the cosmos.

May heaven and earth be bright and pure, the celestial signs clear and mysterious, floods and droughts forever dispelled, locusts and pests never arise. May the three frontiers know perpetual peace, disasters and epidemics sink into obscurity, wind and rain arrive in season, harvests be abundant in years of plenty. May heaven bestow sweet dew, earth bring forth auspicious clouds, the nation prosper with worthy ministers, households abound with filial piety and fraternal duty.

Next, may the prisons of Mount Luofeng, the eight difficulties and nine dark realms, cease their torments, and the suffering souls forever escape the three evil destinies.

The repentant one, so-and-so, from kalpas without beginning until this present kalpa and life, together with nine generations of ancestors, parents, and all kin, by the power of this repentance and merit, may all attain liberation and return to the true Dao.

One bow.

chunks.original_text: 广救人民品第二 今日道场大众，人各运心，仰对慈尊，广救人民，说诸善利。 忏主某敛心接手，谛听经言，常念众生，处於三毒、十恶之世，被诸魍魉精魅、恶鬼邪神、毒虫猛兽、刀兵水火、杻械牢狱、疾病苦痛，一一缠染，不能自安。 故演三洞经戒，济救斋法，普度众生，及以符图神咒，付诸法学，及诸天帝、救苦真人、三天大魔王、五天魔王，分布世间，救护一切，令得自在。 然众生愚痴，不识罪福，放纵六情，杀生偷盗，邪淫游荡，悭贪瞋怒，情性颠倒，绮言妄语，恶口两舌，啖食众生，破斋破戒，违天负地，背正信邪，咒诅神鬼，众罪纵横，而无片善。 是致毒风恶气，六天魔鬼，遍满世界，流行杀伐，中害死伤，日夜万计，不可称量。 慈尊遣诸天帝、十极神王、三界四司，下降人间，按行救度，拯济众生，遍满天地，人岂知之。 今重告汝，救护之法，不可思议，克感灵应。 普济称言，大慈大悲，能为众生，愿垂付嘱。 慈尊言，常以岁旦八节、三元晦望、五腊十直此诸等日，善男信女，到於斯日，不食荤秽，制断六情，不生念想，即乃清净，烧香持斋，念道礼我化号。 首谢己身，发露忏悔，乃得迁功补过，免受苦厄。 若己身不专，当请男官法身、女官法身，精心恳祷，礼拜供养。 若於家庭，若於灵观，以华果斋食，旛华香火、及舍衣彩、卧具床帐、锦绣茵褥、香油米面，随其所有，即得善神立降，度兔厄难。 若身所负恶疾，邪病缠绵，丑宿加临，连年不解，虚耗侵凌，财帛散失。 或生产育，怀抱夭折。 或舍身出家，长乃退悔。 或夜梦百怪，神思不安，火烛惊恐，官事横受，抵犯禁方，不避神杀，干触坟墓，水火冲破，木石绞结，为祸作戾，种种厄苦，不祥兆朕，但於家庭，广作修崇，随力多少，礼我应号，然灯烧香，不舍昼夜，四天帝王，下来扶护我之应号。 所禳者伏，所求者应，所陈者达，所告者从，拔赎咎债，救护存亡，建此祈禳，最为第一。 若帝王国主、大臣宰辅、诸王妃后、帝子天孙，能为父母、己身眷属、朝戚皇亲、行其救拔，广召男官法身、女官法身，不以多少，於其宫殿，持斋行道，礼拜忏悔，以日继夜，不住时刻，勤心不退，则有十天真人、四司五帝下降，按察功过，病者得差，死者得活，厄者得度，禁者得脱，行者得还，仕者得升。 水火刀兵、虎狼毒兽、邪精鬼魅，永不干身，无触无犯。 若有民庶，能为帝王国主、人民土地、一切众生，礼我化号真像，救护群品，愿各各安乐，最不可思议。 若兵革四起，侵窃疆界，礼我化号真像，即得戈鋋退散，无损无害。 若疫毒临人，修禳不解，礼我化号真像，即得病患痊愈，不萦缠染。 若水旱不调，五谷不熟，礼我化号真像，即得调顺，万物滋荣。 若恶风毒气，飘灼人民，礼我化号真像，即得所染病苦，应时廖退，体气恬和。 若恶虫猛兽，残害民物、一切畜类，礼我化号真像，虫虎奔溃，山神掩藏。 若人怀孕临产，未见平善，礼我化号真像，即得子母团圆，解免无难。 万灾消灭，千变万化，止转我身，我之化号，弘护有情，无愿不果。 但能志心，无急不济。 今日道场大众，人各运心，如经所言，当须精志，礼诸化身应号。
chunks.translated_text:
**Second Scroll: The Salvation of the People**

Today, in this grand Daoist sanctuary, all present turn their minds upward, gazing toward the Merciful Honored One, to broadly save the people and expound all virtuous benefits.

The repentant one, so-and-so, gathers their thoughts, joins their hands, and listens attentively to the scriptural words, ever mindful of sentient beings dwelling in an age of the three poisons and ten evils, beset by specters and malevolent spirits, wicked ghosts and wayward deities, venomous creatures and fierce beasts, blades and warfare, flood and fire, fetters and prisons, sickness and suffering—each affliction clinging fast, leaving none at peace.

Thus are the Three Caverns’ scriptures and precepts expounded, the rites of deliverance and purification performed, to universally ferry all beings across. Talismans, sacred diagrams, and divine incantations are entrusted to those who study the Dao, along with the Heavenly Emperors, the Saviors of Suffering Perfected Ones, the Three Great Demon Kings of Heaven, and the Five Demon Kings of Heaven, who spread throughout the world to rescue and protect all, granting them freedom.

Yet sentient beings, deluded and ignorant, fail to recognize sin and blessing. They indulge the six senses, killing and stealing, engaging in debauchery and dissipation, stinginess and wrath, their natures inverted. They speak deceitfully, utter falsehoods, slander with harsh words and divisive tongues, devour living beings, break fasts and violate precepts, defy heaven and betray earth, turn from the true and embrace the perverse, curse gods and spirits—sins rampant, with not a shred of goodness.

Thus do poisonous winds and malignant qi, the demonic hordes of the Six Heavens, fill the world, spreading slaughter and strife. Those struck down and wounded number in the tens of thousands each day, beyond all reckoning.

The Merciful Honored One dispatches the Heavenly Emperors, the Ten Ultimate Divine Kings, and the Four Administrators of the Three Realms to descend into the human realm, traversing and rescuing, delivering sentient beings, filling heaven and earth—yet who among them knows this?

Now I solemnly declare to you: the methods of salvation are inconceivable, their spiritual responses swift. In universal deliverance, I proclaim with great compassion and mercy, entreating the Honored One to bestow these teachings.

The Merciful Honored One says: On the first day of the year, the eight solar terms, the Three Primes, the dark and full moons, the Five La Days, and the Ten Straight Days—on all such occasions, good men and faithful women who observe these days must abstain from meat and impurity, restrain the six senses, and banish all wayward thoughts. Thus purified, they burn incense, maintain the fast, recite the Dao, and pay homage to my transformed names.

First, they repent for their own transgressions, openly confessing their faults, thereby transferring merit to amend their errors and escape suffering and calamity. If one cannot focus alone, they may invoke the Dharma-bodies of male or female officiants, praying earnestly with devotion, making offerings and prostrations.

Whether at home or in sacred temples, with flowers, fruits, vegetarian meals, banners, blossoms, incense, lamps, and offerings of clothing, bedding, curtains, embroidered mats, fragrant oils, rice, and flour—whatever they possess—then the benevolent spirits will descend at once, delivering them from misfortune.

If one suffers from grave illness, chronic ailments, or the malevolent influence of the Ox Mansion, lingering for years without relief, their vitality drained, their wealth dissipated; if childbirth brings misfortune, or infants perish in their arms; if one leaves the household to become a monastic, only to later regret it; if nightmares and strange visions disturb the mind, or fires and alarms cause terror; if legal troubles arise unjustly, or one violates sacred prohibitions, defies divine retribution, disturbs graves, or is struck by flood, fire, entangling trees, or crushing stones—all manner of calamities, omens, and afflictions—then within the home, perform extensive rites of repentance and supplication. According to one’s means, pay homage to my transformed names, kindle lamps and burn incense day and night without cease. The Four Heavenly Emperor-Kings will descend to protect my transformed names.

The exorcised will be subdued, the sought will be granted, the presented will be conveyed, the entreated will be heeded. Transgressions will be redeemed, the living and the dead will be saved. This form of prayer and exorcism is foremost.

If emperors, kings, great ministers, and royal advisors, along with princes, consorts, imperial children, and celestial descendants, act on behalf of their parents, themselves, their kin, court relatives, and imperial kin, summoning the Dharma-bodies of male and female officiants—regardless of number—to their palaces, where they maintain the fast, practice the Dao, and perform repentance day and night without pause, their devotion unwavering, then the Ten Perfected Ones of Heaven and the Four Administrators and Five Emperors will descend to assess their merits and faults. The sick will recover, the dead will revive, the imperiled will be delivered, the imprisoned will be freed, travelers will return, and officials will be promoted. Water, fire, blades, warfare, tigers, wolves, venomous beasts, malevolent spirits, and spectral entities will never assail them, nor will they suffer harm or offense.

If common folk act on behalf of emperors, kings, the people, the land, and all sentient beings, paying homage to my transformed names and true images, delivering all beings, each will attain peace and bliss—this is most inconceivable.

If warfare erupts on all four fronts, encroaching upon borders, pay homage to my transformed names and true images, and the weapons of war will retreat, leaving no harm or damage.

If plague and pestilence strike the people, and exorcisms bring no relief, pay homage to my transformed names and true images, and the afflicted will recover, free from lingering illness.

If floods and droughts disrupt the seasons, and the five grains fail to ripen, pay homage to my transformed names and true images, and the elements will harmonize, all things flourishing.

If poisonous winds and malignant qi scorch the people, pay homage to my transformed names and true images, and the afflictions will vanish at once, the body and qi restored to tranquility.

If venomous creatures and fierce beasts ravage the people and all living beings, pay homage to my transformed names and true images, and the insects and tigers will flee, the mountain spirits concealing them.

If a woman is pregnant and childbirth brings peril, pay homage to my transformed names and true images, and mother and child will be reunited, free from danger.

Ten thousand disasters will vanish, a thousand transformations and myriad changes will cease. Turn to me, to my transformed names, who broadly protect all sentient beings—no wish will go unfulfilled. With sincere devotion, no peril will remain unaverted.

Today, in this grand Daoist sanctuary, all present must turn their minds as the scriptures instruct, with utmost devotion, paying homage to all transformed names and manifestations.

chunks.original_text: 解众生结缚品第三 今日道场大众，人各运心，仰对慈尊，无极大道、一切真圣，为以众生，解诸结缚。 忏主某身心清净，稽首增念，经言，元始以一气而化三才，天地运动，万物生成，人居其内，禀质养形，悉因所化。 外资秀气，表裹相因，而成五德。 众生受荫，内外包罗，十月出胎，周回十气，气运化生，百节开张。 一一节中气成十结，一一结内皆有一神，结习相因，罪累缠缚。 解其结缚，和畅百神，故立十方，而留亿号。 一一应号，能为众生，解其结缚。 若以众生结解，深悟道源，如似世间击贼，须召千兵，及获一贼，一兵不用，且众生身假地水火风，阴阳显晦，皆从五脏六根相染。 心王意马种造，疑惑之结、盘根之结、滞碍之结、伤残之结、病患之结、口舌之结、冤家之结、笃疾之结、喑哑之结、戏玩之结、交易之结、酒食之结、杀害之结、汤火之结、嫉妬之结、妄语之结、轻薄之结、贪求之结、勇猛之结、破斋之结、犯戒之结、好弄之结、劳心之结、积恨之结、无惭之结、爱欲之结、耳不闻声之结、眼不视物之结、心闷之结、气怒之结、天罗之结、地网之结、水火之结、洞房之结、相克之结、相妨之结。 如是一切众生，身居天地，形受荣枯，火宅煎仍，浮生扰扰，有诸烦结，障恼肉身，结结相因，永无休息。 普济问言，何为心王意马。 慈尊言，心若师王，意如猿马，难降难伏，变转不停。 猿马虽止，心王不息。 若以善伏师王，意马则不能变转。 既停变转，乃结业不生。 普济问言，以何善力，教示众生，悟解诸结？ 慈尊言，众生欲求悟解，於清净处，严洁家庭，随力丰俭，然香点灯，於我像前，礼诸化号，忏悔冤结，谛听思惟，勇猛精进，悟解诸结，免遭沈坠。 乘此忏力，当降金刚百炼、玉液千和、太白流光、元黄散逸，洗涤淫邪，解冤除结，去烦去恼，安泰身心，善邪自会，恶亦相磨。 四梵真人、十方化主，当使众生，悉令开悟。 业业不起，善善自深，而得回生，何由不拔。 又念众生，若能善解一结，即百结皆宽，即得上升清气，下降天符阿修猛将、铁额铜头护法神王、玉钩金锁，千结万恨，顿息心猿，似橘如珠，永停意结，心永无心，结永无结，冤憎解释，消网除罗。 当愿一切众生，永悟真道，得以解脱。 今日道场大众，人各运心，谛听在心，如经所言，众生处世，永执烦笼，解离无由，何所逃遁。 礼斯忏法，顿悟萦缠，今可思惟，精进礼念。 愿以善力，遍及有情，所受缠结，皆乘忏力，得悟无为，登至真道。 忏主某又念人居浮世，日积恶气，身有三业，口多四过，业根相系，结聚难抛。 今则澄炼身形，洗除尘染。 今日伏为平安　追荐礼此忏文，五体投地，一心发念，稽首慈尊，敬礼真圣。 志心敬礼，玉清降福天尊。 志心敬礼，寻声救苦天尊。 志心敬礼，玉虚明皇天尊。 志心敬礼，遍立功德天尊。 志心敬礼，遐宣道瘾天尊。 志心敬礼，功德严净天尊。 志心敬礼，慈悲说法天尊。 志心敬礼，太上教化天尊。 志心敬礼，难思圣德天尊。 志心敬礼，妙彩金容天尊。 志心敬礼，生成四气天尊。 志心敬礼，证果随愿天尊。 志心敬礼，开道往生天尊。 志心敬礼，万福堂天尊。

**Chapter Three: Unbinding the Knots of Sentient Beings**

Today, within this sacred precinct, all assembled turn their minds in reverence toward the Merciful Honored One, the Boundless Dao, and all true sages, that for the sake of sentient beings, they may untie all knots and fetters.

The repentant sponsor, so-and-so, with purified body and mind, bows in profound devotion. As the scriptures declare: In the beginning, the Primordial One transformed the Three Realms with a single qi. Heaven and earth move, and the myriad things take form; humanity dwells within, receiving its nature and nurturing its form, all born of this transformation. Externally, it draws upon refined qi; internally and externally, the five virtues intermingle to take shape. Sentient beings, enveloped within, emerge from the womb after ten months, encircled by the ten qi. As qi circulates and gives life, the hundred joints unfold. Within each joint, qi forms ten knots, and within each knot resides a spirit. Habitual patterns intertwine, and transgressions coil into bonds.

To untie these knots and harmonize the hundred spirits, the ten directions are established, each bearing countless names. Each invoked name has the power to unbind the knots of sentient beings. If the knots of sentient beings are dissolved, they deeply awaken to the source of the Dao—much like in the worldly realm, where capturing a thief requires summoning a thousand soldiers, yet once the thief is seized, not a single soldier is needed.

Moreover, the body of sentient beings is a temporary convergence of earth, water, fire, and wind, of yin and yang, manifest and hidden, all arising from the mutual contamination of the five viscera and six senses. The mind-king and the will-steed sow and cultivate: knots of doubt and delusion, knots of entanglement and obstruction, knots of injury and harm, knots of illness and affliction, knots of slander and strife, knots of enmity and grievance, knots of chronic ailment, knots of muteness and silence, knots of frivolity and play, knots of trade and exchange, knots of wine and gluttony, knots of killing and harm, knots of scalding and fire, knots of jealousy and envy, knots of false speech, knots of frivolity and disdain, knots of greed and desire, knots of reckless bravery, knots of breaking fasts, knots of violating precepts, knots of idle amusement, knots of mental exhaustion, knots of accumulated resentment, knots of shamelessness, knots of lust and desire, knots of deafness, knots of blindness, knots of mental confusion, knots of anger and rage, knots of heavenly nets, knots of earthly snares, knots of water and fire, knots of the bridal chamber, knots of mutual conflict, knots of mutual hindrance.

All such sentient beings, dwelling within heaven and earth, experience the flourishing and withering of form. The burning house seethes unceasingly; floating life is ever restless. With all these vexing knots obstructing and tormenting the fleshly body, knot upon knot intertwines without end.

Pǔjì inquired: What is meant by the mind-king and the will-steed?

The Merciful Honored One replied: The mind is like a sovereign king; the will is like a monkey or a horse—difficult to tame, difficult to subdue, ever-shifting and unceasing. Even if the monkey and horse are stilled, the mind-king does not rest. If one skillfully subdues the sovereign king, the will-steed cannot shift and turn. Once shifting and turning cease, karmic knots no longer arise.

Pǔjì inquired: By what virtuous power may sentient beings be taught to awaken and dissolve these knots?

The Merciful Honored One replied: If sentient beings seek awakening and dissolution, let them, in a place of purity, adorn and purify their homes. According to their means, whether abundant or modest, let them light incense and lamps before my image, venerate the transformed names, repent of grievances and knots, listen attentively, contemplate deeply, and advance with courage and diligence. Thus may they awaken and dissolve all knots, avoiding the depths of suffering.

By the power of this repentance, let there descend the hundredfold-refined vajra, the thousandfold-blended jade elixir, the flowing light of Venus, the dispersed radiance of primal yellow. Let these wash away lewdness and perversity, dissolve grievances and knots, dispel vexation and torment, pacify body and mind. Let goodness and evil naturally align, and malevolence be ground away. May the Four Brahma Perfected Ones and the transformative lords of the ten directions enable all sentient beings to awaken. Let evil karma not arise, and let goodness deepen, that they may attain rebirth—how could they not be delivered?

Furthermore, if sentient beings skillfully dissolve even a single knot, a hundred knots will loosen. They will ascend in pure qi and descend with heavenly talismans. The fierce generals Axiū, Iron-Forehead, and Copper-Headed Dharma-Protecting Divine Kings, with jade hooks and golden locks, will instantly still the thousand knots and myriad resentments, quieting the mind-monkey. Like an orange or a pearl, the will’s knots will forever cease. The mind will be without mind, and knots without knots. Enmity and hatred will be resolved, nets and snares dissolved.

May all sentient beings forever awaken to the true Dao and attain liberation.

Today, within this sacred precinct, all assembled turn their minds to listen attentively, as the scriptures declare: Sentient beings in the world are forever bound by the cage of affliction, with no means of escape—where can they flee? By venerating this repentance ritual, they may suddenly awaken from their entanglements. Now, let them contemplate deeply and advance in reverent devotion.

May the power of virtue extend to all sentient beings, that all the knots they bear may, by the power of repentance, awaken to non-action and ascend to the true Dao.

The repentant sponsor, so-and-so, further reflects: Dwelling in the floating world, one daily accumulates evil qi. The body bears the three karmic actions; the mouth commits the four transgressions. Karmic roots intertwine, and knots gather, difficult to cast off. Today, let the body be refined and purified, the dust of defilement washed away.

Today, prostrating for peace and offering prayers through this repentance text, with the five limbs touching the earth and the mind single-mindedly devoted, the repentant sponsor bows to the Merciful Honored One and reverently venerates the true sages.

With sincere devotion, reverently venerate the Jade Purity Heavenly Worthy who bestows blessings.

With sincere devotion, reverently venerate the Heavenly Worthy with wondrous golden countenance.
With sincere devotion, reverently venerate the Heavenly Worthy who engenders the four qi.

With sincere devotion, reverently venerate the Heavenly Worthy who opens the Dao to rebirth.
With sincere devotion, reverently venerate the Heavenly Worthy of the Hall of Ten Thousand Blessings.

Today, the master of repentance in this Daoist ritual, together with the great assembly, prostrate in utmost sincerity, gazing upward in hope that the Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Upper Realm, all the Venerables and Sages, all the Great Transformative Titles, all the Great Manifestations, all the Great Divine Immortals, all the Great Assemblies of Sages, all the Great Divine Youths, and all the Worthies and Sages throughout the ten directions and the boundless reaches of the Mysterious Void—all the Perfected and Sages—may, through the might of the Vajra Guardians and the waters of Supreme Harmony, cleanse the accumulated defilements within the body of the repentance master, named so-and-so, purifying the field of the heart-mind. May obstructions dissolve, the flow of nourishing and protective qi circulate, and all share a purified heart-mind, continuously cultivating goodness without generating defiled thoughts or stirring afflictive toil.

Today, this Daoist ritual is conducted with purity as its purpose. May the ancestral spirits, the consciousness of departed kin, parents, and family members swiftly escape karmic entanglements, never to sink into suffering. May the living and the deceased of two generations together ascend to the fruition of the Dao.

One bow.

**Chapter Four: Arousing the Heart of Praise**

Today, in this Daoist ritual, each member of the great assembly directs their heart-mind upward, gazing toward the Compassionate Venerable One, exhorting all beings to arise in praise.

The repentance master, named so-and-so, gathers their heart-mind, kneels in reverence, and listens attentively to the scriptural words: No one receives birth without arising from past karma. Thus, each is endowed with a divine and outstanding nature, each with its own karmic conditions. Transgressions and blessings, fortune and misfortune—all proceed from karma. Therefore, short or long lifespans, nobility or lowliness, wealth or poverty, beauty or ugliness, foolishness or wisdom—each differs according to prior determination. If one knows they have committed the three karmic actions or the ten evils, their transgressions are grave and weighty. They should awaken to remorse, seek repentance, and perform rites of contrition. Let boundless thoughts arise from an immeasurable heart-mind. Whenever encountering good conditions, one must offer praise. The merit of praise is inconceivable.

If one sees the emperor, sovereign, empress, imperial consorts, princes, princesses, ministers, and high officials arouse a heart of great goodness, one must offer praise, wishing that blessings protect the realm and the imperial enterprise endure forever.

If one sees the construction of palaces or the establishment of vast Daoist altars, one must offer praise, wishing for swift completion and the attainment of refuge.

If one sees the imperial grace bestowing ordination upon male and female officials and Daoists, one must offer praise, wishing for liberation from suffering and purity across three lifetimes.

If one sees the adornment and casting of sacred images, the true responsive and transformative bodies, one must offer praise, arousing a heart of reverence and making offerings without cease.

If one sees the transcription of the Three Caverns’ Great Canon of sacred scriptures, one must offer praise, wishing for eternal circulation and the transformation and deliverance of all.

If one sees halls, pavilions, towers, and terraces adorned with splendor and elegance, one must offer praise, wishing that all may attain refuge and constantly behold and revere them.

If one sees bells, chimes, and Daoist implements of bronze and iron, one must offer praise, wishing to awaken the deluded masses and make their voices heard in the darkest nights.

If one sees the expounding of various scriptures and the elucidation of wondrous meanings, one must offer praise, wishing to ride the merit to liberate those imprisoned in suffering.

If one sees the recitation of scriptures and repentance texts, their upholding, and the making of offerings, one must offer praise, wishing to attain the conditions for the Dao and remain steadfast without retreat.

If one sees the performance of ritual circumambulation, hymns of praise, prayers for blessings, and petitions for fortune, one must offer praise, wishing that the power of blessings universally pervade worlds as numerous as motes of dust.

If one sees men and women burning incense, lighting lamps, and diligently prostrating in reverence, one must offer praise, wishing their prayers be fulfilled.

If one sees the burning of incense, one must offer praise, universally wishing that the fragrant smoke be offered to all Perfected and Sages.

If one sees the illumination of lamps dispelling darkness, one must offer praise, wishing that karmic debts be forever dissolved and all attain equality with the sun and moon.

If one sees the observance of fasts, the upholding of precepts, and the making of offerings to the Perfected and Sages, one must offer praise, wishing that all sentient beings in the world, all creatures with consciousness, forever enter the Dharma gate and never sink into the realms of suffering.

If one sees the making of offerings to humans and gods, one must offer praise, wishing for towering blessings and longevity, and inexhaustible wealth and fortune.

If one sees diligent devotion, thought after thought of utmost sincerity, one must offer praise, wishing for no retreat and constant joy.

If one sees courageous reverence and the arousal of a heart of great goodness, one must offer praise, wishing to avoid encountering demonic obstacles and swiftly attain the true Dao.

If one sees those who dwell at home constantly reciting scriptures and repentance texts, one must offer praise, wishing that all heavenly Perfected may hear and behold them.

If one sees those who dwell in mountains to cultivate the Dao, residing in hermitages and cliffs, guarding their resolve in tranquility, seeking neither fame nor profit, one must offer praise, wishing that those who first attain the Dao may sequentially open the path to deliverance for others.

If one sees men and women of upright bearing, one must offer praise, universally wishing that they leave the household life and perpetuate the true teaching.

If one sees all good conditions in the world, one must offer praise, wishing that humans and gods attain fruition and all receive benefit.

Through such manifold praises of good deeds, exhort and inspire all beings to accomplish the heart-mind of the Dao and enter diligent practice. Thus may the nine generations of ancestors, the seven generations of forebears, one’s own parents, uncles, brothers, oneself, one’s descendants, and all family members—from beginningless kalpas to the present kalpa, in this life and this birth, through the accumulated actions of today—all the heavy transgressions of the three karmic actions, the six sense faculties, the five rebellious acts, and the ten evils be completely dissolved.

The Tenth Scroll of the *Tai Shang Merciful Dao Ritual for Eliminating Disasters and the Nine Dark Realms*

Compiled by Ge Xuan, the Left Immortal Duke of the Great Ultimate

**Chapter One: Manifesting Merit and Receiving Blessings**

Today, the great assembly of this Dao ritual, each directing their mind, respectfully addresses the Merciful Honored One, declaring their merits to receive blessings. The repentance master, so-and-so, joins palms, kneels, and listens attentively to the scriptural teachings.

The Universal Salvation inquires: The various Dharma gates of merit manifested by the Merciful Honored One exhort and instruct sentient beings to cultivate practice. Yet beings are weak and feeble, unable to fully accomplish these; we wonder what levels of merit may be attained through cultivation.

The Merciful Honored One says: Merit is boundless, but broadly speaking, there are nine types, each yielding blessings according to one’s capacity. All beings should listen carefully:

1. Creating images
2. Copying scriptures
3. Establishing temples
4. Liberating beings
5. Conducting Dao rituals
6. Reciting scriptures and performing repentance rites
7. Upholding precepts
8. Universally offering vegetarian feasts and provisions
9. Practicing generosity

Whether constructing halls, pavilions, towers, galleries, permanent estates, banners, flowers, lamps, candles, bells, chimes, cymbals, or other ritual implements—all such endeavors accumulate boundless merit, bringing immeasurable blessings in the past, present, and future, beyond conception.

Those who create images or copy scriptures will, in this life, attain noble status and, in past lives, be reborn in the families of heavenly kings. Those who establish temples and liberate beings will, in this life, attain great wealth and, in past lives, be reborn in the families of kings. Those who perform rituals and recite invocations will, in this life, be protected by benevolent spirits and, in past lives, be reborn with keen intelligence. Those who uphold vegetarian precepts, revere the teachings, and burn incense will, in this life, enjoy enduring peace and, in past lives, be reborn in wealthy and noble families. Those who observe precepts and repent will, in this life, be revered and protected by the gods and, in past lives, be reborn among humans with perfect form and appearance. Those who offer scriptures and images will, in this life, receive good karmic retribution and, in past lives, be reborn with handsome features. Those who offer vegetarian feasts and provisions will, in this life, have abundant clothing and food and, in past lives, be reborn with dignified bearing. Those who give alms to the poor will, in this life, attain radiant perfection and, in past lives, be reborn with auspicious marks.

chunks.original_text: 不啖食众生者，见世得无病无苦，过去得长寿身。 不饮酒食肉者，见世得精神附体，过去受贤圣身。 不嗜欲知足者，见世得体无臭腋，过去生清净身。 放生赎命者，见世得无夭折，过去生恭敬身。 说法教化者，见世得福慧双修，过去生出家身。 且如功德报应，如响应声，如形对影，大小无异，清浊自分，汝之愚迷，不识因缘，不信罪福，不知此身，从前身种福中来，不知此身暂生即灭，不知此身总是虚假，不知此身念念无常，只恣悭贪、杀生偷盗、邪淫放荡、啖食众生、绮言妄语、谤毁经教、多聚资财，常谓此生无有寿限。 况是一切众生，开眼则造罪无数，闭眼则已入狴牢。 终身造罪，岂曾觉悟，不能发一念善心，散过去、未来受生之业。 自度己身，种其芽蘗，却念子孙，愁无所活。 我念世人，溘断哭泣，少时便自忧忆子孙男女，讵忆父母养育之恩。 自以无始已来，递相仿习，无一悟解，转恣愚痴。 复念一切汝辈，愚愚相习，永不自觉，故示罪福宿命因缘，令出离苦爱欲河中。 又念众生流浪沈沦，不出苦海，此之世界，名曰弃贤宛利天境，亦曰杂报世界。 染欲爱天生在其中，暂生即灭，暂聚即散，如彼电光，须臾即没，生老病死，痛痒疼酸，饥寒燥湿，水火刀兵，魔精鬼贼，毒风恶疰，交相中害，念念无常，曾不暂住，苦恼几何。 目前行事，身自缠绕，尚不觉知，岂肯信有，诸天道境，福地神仙，长生不死，自在无为。 我观世之受生，促於蜉蝣； 世之安居，迫於毫末； 世之臭处，甚於厕秽； 世之快乐，何异粪虫。 犹自不知，常为安乐，岂不是苦。 复念人之受生，未有不从先业来者，故察神挺质，各有因缘，罪福吉凶，悉从其业。 所以寿夭贵贱，贫富好丑，愚智等类，各各不同，乃至鸟兽虫鱼、鸡犬草木，亦复如然。 况以人生受身，甚难逢遇，一朝败坏，万劫何期。 我故殷懃戒劝汝等，所以戒劝勤修，斋戒行道，诵经礼拜，烧香然灯，布施忏悔。 发愿济生度死，造像写经，度人立观，水断造桥，道边立井，度诸行人，济诸困渴，种种方便，为其众生，作当来径路。 我岂有所求，一切众生，宜各思惟。 今日道场大众，如经所言，所示之法，广略难思，殷懃为我等众，启诸福基，当作来路，我今礼念，各自精勤。 愿此功德，利益无边，应是一切含识，皆得受润。 忏主某伏为平安　追荐礼此忏文，愿以功德，随心感应，五体投地，一心发念。 稽首慈尊，敬礼真圣。 志心敬礼，玉清降福天尊。 志心敬礼，寻声救苦天尊。 志心敬礼，真皇洞神天尊。 志心敬礼，太光常照天尊。 志心敬礼，法体圆满天尊。 志心敬礼，紫霞浮盖天尊。 志心敬礼，玄智远照天尊。 志心敬礼，湛寂体玄天尊。 志心敬礼，散威形天尊。 志心敬礼，随机赴感天尊。 志心敬礼，超生死天尊。 志心敬礼，光明天尊。 志心敬礼，道气天尊。 志心敬礼，大元天尊。 志心敬礼，光像天尊。 志心敬礼，证道天尊。 志心敬礼，福寿天尊。 志心敬礼，明应天尊。 志心敬礼，北极天尊。 志心敬礼，无上天尊。 志心敬礼，真品内名天尊。 志心敬礼，乐素缘天尊。 志心敬礼，太一救苦天尊。 志心敬礼，长生保命天尊。 志心敬礼，普慈护国天尊。

Those who refrain from consuming living beings will, in this life, enjoy freedom from illness and suffering and, in past lives, attain a long-lived body. Those who abstain from wine and meat will, in this life, have spirits that abide in their bodies and, in past lives, be reborn with the bodies of sages and worthies. Those who are free from craving and content with little will, in this life, have bodies free from foul odors and, in past lives, be reborn with pure bodies. Those who release life and ransom creatures will, in this life, be spared from premature death and, in past lives, be reborn with reverent bodies. Those who expound the teachings and transform others will, in this life, attain the dual cultivation of blessings and wisdom and, in past lives, be reborn with the bodies of renunciates.

Moreover, the retribution of meritorious deeds is like an echo responding to sound, like a shadow following form—no difference in magnitude, purity and turbidity naturally distinct. Yet you, in your ignorance and delusion, fail to recognize causes and conditions, disbelieve in the consequences of sin and merit, and do not understand that this body arises from the seeds of past blessings. You do not know that this body is but a fleeting apparition, that it is utterly illusory, that it is momentary and impermanent. Instead, you indulge in stinginess and greed, killing living beings, stealing, engaging in illicit sex and dissipation, consuming living creatures, uttering deceitful and frivolous speech, slandering the scriptures and teachings, amassing wealth—all the while believing this life has no limit.

Consider all beings: with eyes open, they commit countless sins; with eyes closed, they enter the prison of suffering. A lifetime of transgressions—when have they ever awakened? They cannot arouse a single thought of goodness to disperse the karmic deeds that bind them to past and future rebirths. Though they seek to liberate themselves, they plant the seeds of affliction, yet fret over their descendants, lamenting their lack of sustenance. I grieve for worldly people, who weep at the moment of death, yet from youth are consumed by worry for their sons and daughters, never recalling the kindness of their parents’ nurture. From time without beginning, they have imitated one another, never awakening, ever sinking deeper into ignorance.

I reflect further on all of you, who follow one another in folly, never self-aware. Thus I reveal the karmic causes and conditions of past lives, that you may emerge from the river of suffering and desire. I also lament that sentient beings drift and drown, never escaping the sea of suffering. This world is called the "Realm of Abandoned Worthies and Profit-Seeking," also known as the "Realm of Mixed Retribution." The heavens of desire and attachment arise within it, fleeting as lightning—appearing for a moment, then vanishing; briefly gathering, then scattering. Birth, aging, sickness, death; pain, itching, soreness, aching; hunger, cold, dryness, dampness; water, fire, blades, weapons; demonic spirits, thieves, poisonous winds, malignant diseases—all these afflictions intertwine, moment by moment impermanent, never abiding for even an instant. How much suffering! Yet even as these torments bind you in the present, you remain unaware—how then could you believe in the celestial realms, the blessed lands of immortals, the Dao of eternal life, and the freedom of non-action?

I observe that the lives of worldly beings are shorter than those of mayflies; their dwellings more cramped than a hair’s tip; their foulness more vile than excrement; their pleasures no different from those of dung-beetles. Yet they remain oblivious, mistaking this for happiness—is this not suffering? I further reflect that no one is born without prior karma. Thus, when examining the essence of spirit and form, each has its causes and conditions. Sin and merit, fortune and misfortune—all arise from karma. Therefore, longevity or premature death, nobility or lowliness, wealth or poverty, beauty or ugliness, foolishness or wisdom—each differs according to its kind, even among birds, beasts, insects, fish, chickens, dogs, grasses, and trees. How much more so for human birth, which is so rarely encountered! Once this body decays, when will it be regained after ten thousand kalpas?

Thus I earnestly admonish and exhort you: diligently cultivate precepts, fast, practice the Dao, recite scriptures, prostrate in worship, burn incense, light lamps, give alms, and repent. Vow to deliver the living and liberate the dead; create images and copy scriptures; establish temples and build bridges; dig wells by the roadside to aid travelers and relieve the thirsty. Through countless expedient means, pave the path for all beings in the future. What do I seek in this? All sentient beings should reflect deeply.

Today, in this grand assembly, as the scriptures teach and the Dharma reveals—whether in full or in part, beyond comprehension—we earnestly establish the foundation of blessings for ourselves and others, creating the path for the future. Now, as I bow in reverence and recite, let each of you be diligent. May these merits benefit all without limit, and may every sentient being receive their nourishment.

chunks.original_text: 志心敬礼，逍遥快乐天尊。 志心敬礼，随愿往生天尊。 志心敬礼，无边际天尊。 志心敬礼，功德海天尊。 志心敬礼，普济真人。 志心敬礼，普慈真人。 志心敬礼，大慈救苦真人。 志心敬礼，大悲拔罪真人。 今日道场忏主，及以大众，仰愿下方无上灵宝天尊，诸尊诸圣、诸大天仙、诸大地仙、五岳仙众，诸大真士、诸大真人，诸大童子，遍十方际丶尽玄虚界、化号一切真圣。 同垂感应，救护一切。 令忏主某所为某事，随心获应，皆乘忏力。 愿患者病安，灾者禳退，远逝者受生，近化者解脱，存者利益，所求得遂。 仍愿四生六道，悉得沾濡，草木附精，孤魂滞魄，乘此良缘，俱超大道。 一拜 追资报答品第二 今日道场大众，人各运心，仰愿慈尊，普施无碍功德，遍及一切人等。 今说追资报答因果。 忏主某伏膺在念，谛听经言，人之受生，天地为象，负阴抱阳，胞胎受荫，悬命由天。 天帝即召主算童子，游行人间，检量罪福，男女吉凶，短长寿命，三日一言，七日一奏，百日一结，不辍须臾。 若修善立功，诸天童子、司命司录，即为延年，消灭灾祸。 若造罪积恶，诸天帝王、六天魔鬼，收系魂魄，上诣三官，令收魂识。 若乃不满算纪者，造罪所致； 得终算纪者，积善所臻。 凡人欲修寿限，皆属地司所辖，诸天诸帝校察，悉依簿籍，定其生死，即与三界官属、察命童子，收摄神魂，以绝生气。 若人当有疾病久缠，床枕沉困所加，命将垂绝，若有家人眷属，随其力分，建置道场，转经礼忏，卷部数目不限多少，家人眷属，仰对诸天诸圣，首谢病苦所犯生身罪业，即放神魂，重延寿算，得以痊愈。 若复大限有期，当复救拔，广作功德，资及逝魂，不缠苦恼。 生人无难，不见恐惧，若从首七，乃至三祥，追远之辰，香灯供养，晨夜不倦。 所以者何？ 复有察命童子监奏罪福，得入生门，福流后嗣，不滞地狱，无受罪业。 喻似世人，初萦公讼，案牍未明，与新逝者，义亦同故。 於是有善恶二神，十日下来，巡校家庭。 作福者，善神保举，令得生天。 若不作福者，恶神领录，入以幽闭，当使家人多恐，凶横缠绕。 既有所苦，但於宫观，或在家庭，向我像前，礼拜隐显化号，修斋行道，拔赎罪业，令得解脱，名标仙籍，身处逍遥。 如是种种，追资报答，因果功德，最为第一，实堪称赞。 若有善男子、善女人，能为父母、一切眷属，画塑仪像，造立殿堂，许发信心，广令劝喻。 若如是者，不可思议，一切人等，於诸法内，起一善心，作一愿乐。 怀心报答，是名善果，不可思议。 今日道场大众，如经所言。 慈尊广为一切众生，说此功德法门，作生死径路，不可思议。 忏主某过去九玄七祖、父母伯叔兄弟、己身一切眷属，若在地狱、饿鬼、畜生含识之类，未乘追荐，未修报答，今当精志礼敬，应号真圣。 愿是功德，遍沾存殁，咸得解脱。 今日伏为平安　追荐礼此忏文，五体投地，一心发念。 稽首慈尊，敬礼真圣。 志心敬礼，玉清降福天尊。 志心敬礼，寻声救苦天尊。 志心敬礼，真皇洞神天尊。 志心敬礼，遍观法界天尊。 志心敬礼，妙光湛寂天尊。 志心敬礼，九色威光天尊。 志心敬礼，出离方便天尊。 志心敬礼，随方享福天尊。

Today, the master of repentance in this Daoist ritual, together with the great assembly, reverently beseech the Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy below, all the Venerable Ones and Sages, all the Great Heavenly Immortals, all the Great Earthly Immortals, the Immortal Hosts of the Five Sacred Peaks, all the Great Perfected Lords, all the Great Perfected Ones, and all the Divine Youths—pervading the ten directions, filling the realms of profound emptiness, and manifesting under every name as all the true and sacred beings. May they together bestow their responsive grace to rescue and protect all beings. May the master of repentance, so-and-so, who undertakes this matter, obtain a response in accordance with their heart, all through the power of this repentance.

May the afflicted recover from illness, may calamities be averted, may those who have passed afar be reborn, may those who have recently departed attain liberation, may the living receive benefit, and may all their prayers be fulfilled. Furthermore, may the four kinds of birth and the six paths of existence all receive this grace; may the spirits of plants and trees, and the lingering souls of the forsaken, seize this auspicious opportunity to ascend together to the Great Dao.

One bow.

**Chapter Two: Repaying Kindness and Offering Merit**

Today, in this Daoist ritual, each member of the great assembly directs their heart and mind, reverently beseeching the Merciful Venerable One to universally bestow boundless merit and virtue upon all people. Now, the causes and effects of repaying kindness are expounded.

The master of repentance, so-and-so, humbly reflects and listens attentively to the scriptural words: When a person is born, Heaven and Earth serve as their model; they bear the yin and embrace the yang, receiving shelter within the womb, their life suspended by Heaven. The Heavenly Emperor then summons the Youth Who Records Lifespans to traverse the human realm, examining and measuring sins and blessings, the fortune or misfortune of men and women, the brevity or length of their lives. Every three days, a report is made; every seven days, a memorial is submitted; every hundred days, a record is finalized—unceasing even for a moment.

If one cultivates goodness and establishes merit, the Divine Youths of the Heavens, the Lords of Life and the Recorders of Deeds, will extend their years and eliminate calamities. If one commits sins and accumulates evil, the Heavenly Kings and the demonic spirits of the Six Heavens will seize their hun and po souls, bringing them before the Three Officials to have their consciousnesses collected. If one’s allotted lifespan is not fulfilled, it is due to the sins they have committed; if one completes their allotted lifespan, it is due to the goodness they have accumulated.

When a person seeks to extend their lifespan, it falls under the jurisdiction of the Earthly Offices. The various Heavens and Emperors examine and verify according to the registers, determining life and death. They then dispatch the officials of the Three Realms and the Youth Who Observes Life to gather the spirit and soul, cutting off the breath of life. If a person is afflicted by prolonged illness, bedridden and gravely stricken, their life nearing its end, and if their family and kin, according to their means, establish a Daoist ritual, recite scriptures, and perform repentance—regardless of the number of scrolls—the family and kin may reverently face the various Heavens and Sages, confessing the karmic offenses of the sick person’s embodied existence, thereby releasing their spirit and soul, extending their lifespan, and restoring them to health.

If the great limit of life is imminent, one may still be rescued through the performance of extensive merit and virtue, dedicating it to the departed soul to spare them from suffering and distress. The living will face no hardship or terror. From the first seventh-day period after death to the three annual commemorations, during the days of ancestral remembrance, offerings of incense and lamps should be made tirelessly, day and night.

Why is this so? There are also the Youths Who Observe Life who monitor and report sins and blessings. If one enters the gate of life, blessings flow to their descendants, they do not linger in hell, and they suffer no karmic retribution. It is like a person initially entangled in a legal dispute, where the case remains unresolved—this is analogous to the situation of the newly deceased.

Thus, two spirits, one of good and one of evil, descend every ten days to inspect the household. For those who perform merit, the good spirit will advocate for them, enabling rebirth in Heaven. For those who do not perform merit, the evil spirit will record their deeds, leading them into confinement, causing their family to experience much fear and misfortune. If there is suffering, one may go to a Daoist abbey or remain at home, facing the image of the Venerable One, bowing to the manifest and hidden transformations, performing purification rituals and practicing the Dao, redeeming karmic offenses to attain liberation. Their names will be inscribed in the registers of immortals, and their bodies will dwell in carefree joy.

Such are the various causes and effects of repaying kindness and offering merit, which are foremost and truly worthy of praise. If there are good men and good women who, for the sake of their parents and all their kin, paint or sculpt images, construct halls, and vow with sincere faith to widely encourage and exhort others—such actions are inconceivable. All people, within the various dharmas, who arouse a single good thought or make a single vow, harboring a heart of gratitude and repayment, are called good fruits, and are inconceivable.

Today, the great assembly in this Daoist ritual, as spoken in the scriptures, reverently beseech the Merciful Venerable One to expound this Dharma gate of merit and virtue for all sentient beings, serving as a path through life and death—this is inconceivable. The master of repentance, so-and-so, for the sake of their nine generations of ancestors, seven generations of forebears, parents, uncles, brothers, themselves, and all their kin—whether in hell, as hungry ghosts, as animals, or among all beings with consciousness—who have not yet received offerings or performed repayment, now wholeheartedly bows in reverence to the true and sacred beings invoked by name. May this merit and virtue pervade both the living and the deceased, enabling all to attain liberation.

Today, humbly for the sake of peace and the offering of merit through this repentance text, prostrating with the five limbs touching the ground, the heart directs its thoughts. Bowing to the Merciful Venerable One, I reverently bow to the true and sacred beings.

chunks.original_text: 志心敬礼，护魂无滞天尊。 志心敬礼，转法随心天尊。 志心敬礼，真空天尊。 志心敬礼，太真天尊。 志心敬礼，运度天尊。 志心敬礼，威神天尊。 志心敬礼，真品天尊。 志心敬礼，冲妙天尊。 志心敬礼，宝秘天尊。 志心敬礼，虚皇天尊。 志心敬礼，慈应元和天尊。 志心敬礼，慈德拔难天尊。 志心敬礼，弘济丹景天尊。 志心敬礼，长生保命天尊。 志心敬礼，太一救苦天尊。 志心敬礼，普慈护国天尊。 志心敬礼，逍遥快乐天尊。 志心敬礼，随愿往生天尊。 志心敬礼，无边际天尊。 志心敬礼，功德海天尊。 志心敬礼，法解真人。 志心敬礼，宝光真人。 志心敬礼，大慈救苦真人。 志心敬礼，大悲拔罪真人。 今日道场忏主，及以大众，归依下方无上灵宝天尊，诸尊诸圣、诸大真人、诸大妙行真士，诸大童子，遍十方际、尽玄虚界、隐现一切真圣。 愿以大慈光力，以大悲力、道力、法力，遍照下方世界，罗酆九幽诸狱。 令忏主某九祖七玄、师尊父母、伯叔兄弟、己身一切眷属，或处於三恶道中，未得超生，远化者、近逝者，悉乘今日，至心忏悔，不以罪业轻重，同得解脱，归依大道。 一拜 叙教流通品第三 今日道场大众，人各运心，归命忏悔，仰对慈尊，说叙教救度流通群品。 忏主某敛心谛听，演示经言，元始以一气化生三气，分为三天，三清之境出於三洞宝经，乃日三乘结飞玄之气，自然成章，玉字金书，龙文凤篆，大方一丈，八角垂芒，教化诸天，流通世界，始终五劫，常转法轮。 虽天地运终，而三洞不灭，开度群品，导引人天，三界十方，俱沾利益。 普济言，三洞下世，未审何时。 为是同来，亦有前后。 慈尊言，每劫之初，洞真下化，人怀道德，处於虚无。 悉奉正真，长生不死。 以次洞玄下化，大朴既亏，淳风已散，人渐浇漓，失道叛德。 以次洞神下化，人转浇浮，不奉大教，背真向伪，年命短促。 三洞不行，智慧日兴，人鬼交杂，运度促急，不满百年，念念无常，沦丧不绝。 我重出世，宣行三洞，布化人间，随代机缘，敷扬经教。 复以圣祖托化人间，救度众生，演出科戒。 或夷或夏，或圣或凡，周遍十方，悉令开度。 三洞妙法，散在人间，劝诱众生，使勤修习。 若人积罪累业，沉迷恶道，不能信奉者，惟从邪伪，诸杂妖神，徒竭身心，终归地狱。 信奉三洞大法者，悉入福堂，或白日升举，尸解遁形，名迹虽存，暗行幽界，人莫能识。 复言我将隐去后，魔教转兴，人民夭折，兵戈水火，疾病缠绵，朝夕相继，竭於财帛，以奉祆诈，伪乱日生，浇讹时扇，饥寒苦恼，父子流移，永无觉悟。 又念汝辈，积劫沉沦，说是要言，以示聋瞽。 且经者，教化众生，使识根源本始，宿命因缘，罪福报对，善恶吉凶，生死门户，方便所由，令改恶从善，保安性命，长生无为，归奉大道。 保之者福降，修之者神佑。 於是诸天上圣妙行真人、神人、仙人，常欲人勤，烧香忏悔，则善神保护，众圣垂念。 若身有罪，内外缠缚，则恶神肆害，疾病加临，水火刀兵，毒虫猛兽，枷锁牢狱，众苦难脱。 若人惟知外饰，面目、衣服、手足，而不知内洗身心、罪根、恶业，不亦愚迷。 如面目、手足、衣服，勤加洗擢，必得清净。

May they, by the power of great compassion, the power of great mercy, the power of the Dao, and the power of the Dharma, universally illuminate the worlds below, the Nine Dark Prisons of Fengdu. May the master of repentance, [Name], their nine generations of ancestors, seven generations of descendants, teachers, parents, uncles, brothers, themselves, and all their kin—whether dwelling in the Three Evil Paths, yet to attain liberation, whether departed long ago or recently passed—all ascend today through sincere repentance. **Chapter Three: The Circulation of Teachings**

Today, the great assembly in this Daoist ritual, each with focused mind, take refuge and repent, gazing reverently upon the Compassionate Venerable One, to expound the teachings of salvation and the circulation of all dharmas.

The master of repentance, [Name], collects their thoughts and listens attentively as the scriptures are revealed: The Primordial Beginning, with one qi, transformed into three qi, dividing into the Three Heavens. The realms of the Three Clarities emerged from the Three Caverns’ treasure scriptures. Thus, the Three Vehicles conjoined the soaring mystery of qi, naturally forming chapters—jade characters and golden writings, dragon scripts and phoenix seals—each a great square of one zhang, with eight corners radiating light. They taught the heavens and circulated through the worlds, turning the Dharma Wheel for five kalpas from beginning to end.

Though heaven and earth may end their course, the Three Caverns shall never perish. They open the path for all beings, guiding humans and gods across the Three Realms and ten directions, all receiving benefit.

It is asked: When did the Three Caverns descend to the world? Did they come simultaneously, or in succession?

The Compassionate Venerable One replied: At the beginning of each kalpa, the Cavern of Perfection descends to transform the world. People embraced virtue and power, dwelling in emptiness and non-being. All upheld the true and correct, attaining long life without death. Next, the Cavern of Mystery descended. The great simplicity had already declined, the pure wind had scattered, and people gradually became frivolous, losing the Dao and rebelling against virtue. Then, the Cavern of Spirit descended. People grew even more frivolous, failing to uphold the great teachings, turning from truth toward falsehood, their lifespans shortening. When the Three Caverns ceased to function, worldly wisdom flourished daily. Humans and ghosts intermingled, the kalpa’s end drew near, lifespans fell below a hundred years, impermanence prevailed in every thought, and ruin never ceased.

I have descended again to proclaim the Three Caverns, spreading transformation among humanity, adapting to the capacities of each era, and propagating the scriptural teachings. Moreover, the Sacred Ancestors have manifested in the human realm to save and deliver sentient beings, expounding precepts and regulations. Whether among the Yi or Xia, whether sages or commoners, they pervaded the ten directions, universally enabling liberation. The wondrous Dharma of the Three Caverns, scattered throughout the world, exhorts sentient beings to diligently cultivate and practice.

Those who accumulate transgressions and karmic burdens, sinking into evil paths, unable to believe and uphold the teachings, follow only falsehoods and various deceptive spirits. They exhaust body and mind, only to descend into hell. Those who believe in and uphold the great Dharma of the Three Caverns shall all enter the Hall of Blessings. Some ascend in broad daylight, others escape through corpse liberation, their forms vanishing into hidden realms. Though their names and traces remain, they secretly traverse the unseen worlds, unknown to others.

Furthermore, it is said: After I withdraw, demonic teachings will flourish. People will die young, wars, floods, and fires will follow one after another, diseases will linger, and suffering will persist day and night. Wealth and treasures will be exhausted in service to deceitful spirits, falsehoods will multiply daily, and the frivolous and deceitful will spread with the times. Hunger, cold, and misery will drive fathers and sons to wander, never awakening.

Again, I reflect upon you all, sunk in the depths of kalpas: I speak these essential words to enlighten the deaf and blind.

Moreover, the scriptures teach sentient beings to recognize the root and origin, the causes of past lives, the retribution of sin and blessing, the auspicious and inauspicious, the gates of life and death, and the means of expedient practice. They urge turning from evil to embrace goodness, preserving life and nature, attaining long life and non-action, and taking refuge in the Great Dao. Those who preserve them shall receive blessings; those who cultivate them shall be divinely protected.

Thus, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, divine beings, and immortals of the heavens always desire that people diligently burn incense and repent, so that benevolent spirits will protect them and the multitude of sages will bestow their thoughts. If one bears transgressions, bound internally and externally, malevolent spirits will wreak havoc, diseases will afflict, and disasters—water, fire, blades, poisonous creatures, fierce beasts, shackles, and prisons—will bring inescapable suffering.

If one only adorns the exterior—face, clothing, hands, and feet—yet fails to inwardly cleanse the body, mind, roots of transgression, and evil karma, are they not foolish and deluded? Just as the face, hands, feet, and clothing, when diligently washed and scrubbed, must become pure.

chunks.original_text: 太极真人言，天尊於福德天中香积世界，集诸天仙众说法之时，念以普济真人，起无畏力，发广念心，为诸众生，请问机缘，说以诸尊应号。 当此之时，地作紫磨金色，天雨宝花，名香异宝，皆随虚空，流满道前，不可称数。 汝等众生，当宜信奉，努力精心，敷扬我法，勿使外魔，破乱境土。 普济真人及诸天众，闻是语已，泣涕追慕，哽咽悲伤，如丧父母。 念愿慈尊，时时戒喻，令我得悟，证无上道。 於是普济白诸天仙圣众言，十方国土，城邑聚落，山林静处，若有精进学仙上士，及以清信仕族，护持经忏，礼念化身应号。 或好纸墨，抄写丝绦静轴，七宝成持，劝喻国人，礼拜供养，如对真形，昼夜不懈，流通宣布，令未闻者闻，未见者见。 如法修行者，当得诸天仙众、仙童玉女、十部威神保护。 此人永得安乐，随心获果，此之威力，不可思议。 犹如虚空，无有边际，说不可尽。 今日道场大众，如经所言，诸尊应号，不可思议。 一切众生，当愿已受、未受苦报者，皆得解脱。 忏主某今日伏为平安　追荐礼此忏文，五体投地，一心发念。 稽首慈尊，敬礼真圣。 志心敬礼，玉清降福天尊。 志心敬礼，寻声救苦天尊。 志心敬礼，真皇洞神天尊。 志心敬礼，和神利物天尊。 志心敬礼，体悟万德天尊。 志心敬礼，幽照无极天尊。 志心敬礼，万行圆满天尊。 志心敬礼，元阳量化天尊。 志心敬礼，演法遍化天尊。 志心敬礼，六通济苦天尊。 志心敬礼，真意天尊。 志心敬礼，紫府天尊。 志心敬礼，游处天尊。 志心敬礼，莲华天尊。 志心敬礼，默念天尊。 志心敬礼，高真天尊。 志心敬礼，玄宫天尊。 志心敬礼，无碍天尊。 志心敬礼，普润无为天尊。 志心敬礼，舟檝普度天尊。 志心敬礼，至德光相天尊。 志心敬礼，太一救苦天尊。 志心敬礼，长生保命天尊。 志心敬礼，逍遥快乐天尊。 志心敬礼，随愿往生天尊。 志心敬礼，普慈护国天尊。 志心敬礼，无边际天尊。 志心敬礼，功德海天尊。 志心敬礼，普济真人。 志心敬礼，普救真人。 志心敬礼，大慈救苦真人。 志心敬礼，大悲拔罪真人。 今日道场忏主，及以大众，仰愿下方无上灵宝天尊，诸尊诸圣、金阙高仙、玉京圣帝、龙神土地、里域真官，诸天仙君、洞天仙众，遍十方际、尽玄虚界、化现一切真圣。 以难思力、无量功德力，令忏主某伏为平安　追荐礼此忏文，上拔九祖七玄，远逝近亡，父母六亲，一切眷属。 乘此忏悔，超生极乐，不滞三涂，不履五苦，及今见在，至亲傍亲，一切枝萝姻眷，长得安乐，永无苦恼。 又愿以禳者、以报者、以业者、以患者，皆承忏力，永依大道。 一拜 显验证实品第四 今日道场大众，人各运心，礼拜归依，仰对慈尊，显验忏法、证实因缘。 忏主某敛心长跪，谛听经言，道生一气，分化三才，应世立名，随机示号，周遍法界，数若尘沙。 更有积学真人，位极诸天，数亦无量。 若有善男子、善女人，能发自然道意，为国主人王、妃后公侯、及以天下人民、九祖七玄、师尊父母、己身一切眷属乃至三涂五苦、八难九幽，昼夜行道，烧香散花，然灯礼拜，天尊圣号者，当得十方天尊、巨亿万众，同来鉴照，列功诸天。 己身福寿无穷，灾消罪灭，国土太平，兆民安乐，三涂罢对，五苦停酸，沉滞含生，俱得解脱。

The Supreme Pole Perfected One spoke: When the Heavenly Worthy was in the Fragrant Accumulation World of the Heaven of Blessed Virtue, expounding the Dao amidst the assembly of celestial immortals, he thought of the Universally Beneficent Perfected One, who arose with fearless power and extended his mind of vast compassion. For the sake of all sentient beings, he inquired about karmic conditions and proclaimed the responsive titles of the various Honored Ones.

At that moment, the earth turned to the hue of refined gold, and the heavens rained down precious flowers, fragrant incense, and wondrous treasures, all drifting through the void to fill the space before the Dao, beyond count. "All you sentient beings, you ought to believe and uphold this, exert yourselves with sincere devotion, propagate my teachings, and not allow external demons to disrupt and disturb the realm."

When the Universally Beneficent Perfected One and the assembly of celestial beings heard these words, they wept in longing and admiration, choked with sorrow, as if they had lost their parents. They vowed that the Merciful Honored One would constantly admonish and instruct them, so that they might awaken and realize the supreme Dao.

Thereupon, the Universally Beneficent addressed the assembly of celestial immortals and sages: "In the cities, towns, villages, and tranquil mountain forests of the lands in the ten directions, if there are diligent scholar-immortals, or pure and faithful officials and clansmen who protect and uphold the scriptures and repentances, reverently invoking the responsive titles of the transformation bodies—if they delight in paper and ink, copying and binding the scrolls with silk cords, adorning them with the seven treasures, and exhorting the people of the realm to bow in worship and make offerings as if facing the true form, unwavering day and night, circulating and proclaiming them so that those who have not heard may hear and those who have not seen may see—those who cultivate in accordance with the Dao shall be protected by the assemblies of celestial immortals, jade maidens, and the ten divisions of mighty spirits. Such persons shall forever attain peace and happiness, fulfill their aspirations, and this majestic power is inconceivable, like the boundless void, impossible to exhaust."

Chapter Four: Manifest Verification and True Realization

Today, in this ritual assembly, each person directs their mind, bows in homage, and takes refuge, gazing up to the Merciful Honored One, manifesting the repentance dharma and verifying the karmic conditions. The repentance master [Name], gathering their mind and kneeling reverently, listens attentively to the scriptural words: "The Dao gives rise to the one qi, which divides and transforms into the three powers. Responding to the world, it establishes names and manifests titles according to conditions, pervading the dharma-realm, as numerous as the grains of dust. Furthermore, there are accomplished scholar-immortals who have ascended to the highest ranks among the heavens, also beyond count.

If there are good men and good women who can arouse the natural intention of the Dao, serving as rulers, kings, queens, consorts, dukes, and the people of the realm, as well as the nine generations of ancestors, the seven lineages, teachers, parents, themselves, and all kin—even those in the three evil destinies, the five sufferings, the eight difficulties, and the nine dark realms—who day and night practice the Dao, burn incense, scatter flowers, light lamps, and bow in worship to the titles of the Heavenly Worthies, then the Heavenly Worthies of the ten directions and their countless assemblies will together come to witness and record their merits among the heavens. Their own blessings and longevity shall be boundless, disasters will vanish, transgressions will be extinguished, the realm will be at peace, the people will be at ease, the three evil destinies will cease their opposition, the five sufferings will halt their bitterness, and all stagnant sentient beings will attain liberation."

chunks.original_text: 尔时，太极真人语玄言子，常以此经，天尊化号，流通广布，使遍十方，令一切男女，抄写供养，至诚礼诵，当感十华真人、金刚力士、三界五帝、一切威灵，护其国土，保佑人民，若能随处立像，功德难量。 若有男官法身、女官法身，至月朔中晦十直、三元八节、本命庚申、会腊之辰，愿国安宁，静心嘿念，天尊应号，当得神仙降接，云鹤来迎。 若能称扬赞叹，劝诸男女，受持礼诵此之圣像，实不可思议。 若有众生，见慈尊应号，生不信想，轻慢法宝，疑毁圣文。 当知此人，从无量劫来，沉沦下鬼，受诸苦报，备历异形，始得受生，还归人道。 愚痴触壁，无所解知，习恶种因，不能信敬。 若有众生，闻此忏法，一句一偈，一尊一号，一礼一拜，生信想心，当知此人，前身曾入宝城，亲闻妙法，及入宝藏，亲曾读诵，今再受生，转加信奉。 若有人见此忏法，初生信重，后起悔心，不礼不诵，心生怠慢，当知此人，虽得人身，异形未断，是致身过之后，再生恶道，万劫受苦，无由解脱。 尔时，太极真人传授经毕，玄即叩头礼谢。 又感真人口传七号应化天尊，令为众生，救存拔亡，尔乃当示众生，咸得礼诵，无怠圣教。 今日道场，忏主某伏为某事礼此忏文，五体投地，一心发念，稽首慈尊，敬礼真圣。 志心敬礼，应化号天尊。 志心敬礼，普得行天尊。 志心敬礼，无量慧天尊。 志心敬礼，常无为天尊。 志心敬礼，满虚空天尊。 志心敬礼，常清净天尊。 志心敬礼，随机感天尊。 今日道场忏主，及以大众，仰愿十方无上灵宝七号应化天尊，同加善力，覆护众生。 令忏主某克谐心愿，罪业报对，皆得解脱，次及见存一切眷属、无障无难、殃注断绝，又愿才智聪敏，道德渊微，功满行圆，宦学名遂，功勋克峻，宠泽弥新，内外同康，尊卑有序，兵戈屏息，风雨顺时，寿考长延，名书玉简，施一报万，永永无穷。 世世生生，沉沦永脱。 子孙继嗣，亿万斯年。
chunks.translated_text:
At that time, the Perfected One of the Great Ultimate addressed the Master of Mystic Words, saying: "Always with this scripture and the transformative titles of the Heavenly Worthy, circulate and widely disseminate them, that they may pervade the ten directions. Let all men and women copy, enshrine, and reverently recite them, and they shall invoke the Ten Flower Perfected Ones, the Vajra Warriors, the Five Emperors of the Three Realms, and all majestic spirits to guard their lands and protect their people. If one establishes images wherever one dwells, the merit shall be immeasurable.

If there be male or female officials of the Dharma-body who, on the ten straight days of the first and last of the month, the Three Origins, the Eight Festivals, the days of their own life-destiny and the Geng-Shen, and the assemblies of the twelfth month, wish for the peace of the realm, quiet their minds, and silently recite the titles of the Heavenly Worthy, then they shall be met by immortals descending to receive them, and cloud-cranes coming to welcome them.

If one extols and praises, exhorting all men and women to receive, uphold, and recite these sacred images, the merit is truly inconceivable.

If there be sentient beings who, upon seeing the compassionate titles of the Heavenly Worthy, harbor disbelief, slight the Dharma-treasure, and doubt or slander the sacred texts, know that such persons have, from kalpas without measure, sunk into the lower ghosts, enduring manifold sufferings and passing through strange forms, only now to be reborn into the human realm. Foolish and blind, they comprehend nothing, habituated to evil causes, unable to believe or revere.

If there be sentient beings who, upon hearing this repentance ritual—be it a single sentence, a single verse, a single title, a single bow—generate a mind of faith, know that such persons in former lives once entered the jeweled city, heard the wondrous Dharma, and entered the jeweled treasury, where they personally read and recited. Now reborn, their faith and devotion only deepen.

If one initially holds this repentance ritual in reverence but later regrets, ceasing to bow or recite, and allows the mind to grow indolent, know that such a person, though possessing a human body, has not yet severed their strange forms. After this life’s transgressions, they shall again fall into evil destinies, suffering for ten thousand kalpas without hope of liberation."

At that time, the Perfected One of the Great Ultimate completed the transmission of the scripture, and the Master of Mystic Words bowed his head in reverence and thanks. Then, moved by the true words, he received the seven transformative titles of the Heavenly Worthy, to be imparted to sentient beings for the salvation of the living and the deliverance of the dead. Thus, all beings shall be shown how to recite them without neglecting the sacred teachings.

Today, in this ritual arena, the repentance-master [Name], prostrating for [specific matter], bows in worship to this repentance text. With five limbs touching the earth and a single mind, he raises his thought, bows his head to the Compassionate Worthy, and reverently salutes the true sages:

With a sincere mind, I bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Transformative Titles.
With a sincere mind, I bow to the Heavenly Worthy Who Pervades All Actions.
With a sincere mind, I bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Boundless Wisdom.
With a sincere mind, I bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Constant Non-Action.
With a sincere mind, I bow to the Heavenly Worthy Who Fills Empty Space.
With a sincere mind, I bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Constant Purity.
With a sincere mind, I bow to the Heavenly Worthy Who Responds to Conditions.

Today, the repentance-master of this ritual arena and the great assembly, looking up, vow that the Seven Transformative Titles of the Heavenly Worthy of the Supreme Numinous Treasure from the ten directions shall together lend their virtuous power to shelter and protect all beings. May the repentance-master [Name] fulfill his heart’s wishes, and may all karmic retributions and opposing forces be dissolved. May all living kin be free from obstacles and calamities, their misfortunes severed. Further, may they gain keen intelligence and profound virtue, their merits complete and their conduct perfected, their official and scholarly aspirations fulfilled, their achievements towering, their honors ever-renewed. May inner and outer realms alike know well-being, with superiors and inferiors in proper order. May weapons be stilled, winds and rains timely, and longevity prolonged. May their names be inscribed on jade tablets, one act of merit repaid ten thousandfold, eternally without end. Life after life, may they forever escape sinking and drowning. May their descendants continue for a hundred million years."

Their own blessings and longevity shall be boundless, disasters will vanish, transgressions will be extinguished, the realm will be at peace, the people will be at ease, the three evil destinies will cease their opposition, the five sufferings will halt their bitterness, and all stagnant sentient beings will attain liberation."

chunks.original_text: 一切有情，同登道岸。 一拜 仙公葛玄言 高上老君曰，如是十方天尊，皆是元始应气而生於十方，安镇国土，教导众生，随其缘感，散影分身，变化无穷，与劫轮转，隐显不恒，开度一切，福被万天。 若道士、女官及诸男女，能发善心，为国主人王、父母妻子、己身眷属、七祖九玄、天下地上、一切众生，随其分力，金银珠玉、瓦石铜铁、丹青绣画，造其形像，布散十方，遍满国土，礼拜供养，立观度人，行道念诵，散花然灯，忏悔发愿，奉戒持斋，见世安乐，过去生天，获福无量，不可思议。 若国主有灾，日月薄蚀，星辰失度，水旱不调，兆人疫疠，兵革四兴，当於灵观玄坛，及於宫殿庭阙，以万二千灯，作十重二百盏，开八方门，使内外圆足，光明朗彻，然於其中，昼夜礼忏，散花烧香，归命十方，一千一百七十灵像，名号称扬念诵，建大宝斋，放生布施，立百高座，讲说三洞大乘妙经，即得国土安乐，天下太平，若公侯牧伯、一切人民，有众灾厄，亦当勤行，见世昌炽，七祖升天，免脱地狱，长夜光明，世世罔极，长享无为然灯之法。 亦可罗列千二百盏，亦可大建宝轮，上安万二千灯，亦可所在立之。 公侯以千，庶人用百，皆依此法。 夜则使灯光不绝，昼则息之。 停散之日，皆当广设大斋，行道赞叹，言功诸天。 得福无量，不可胜言。 於是十方真人及诸徒众，一时稽首，称善而退。 今日道场忏主某一心谛听仙公葛玄言，吾自受此经已来，立斯忏法，散及同道，令遍天下，广为人民，济其危难，后见当山土地、木石附精，当来拥护，称荷道荫，从此流传次第，普救众生。 且如灵和国王，身抱疾苦，将逾百日，中命垂绝。 太子皇后及诸嫔妃，昼夜哀鸣，无以为计。 有一化身道士，说是天尊应号，功德难思，能济王命，即召男官法身、女官法身，一切清众，於王大殿，修斋行道，烧香散花，然灯礼拜，天尊圣号，发愿忏悔，愿得王体休安。 不逾一腊，度厄真人，下为开度，免其垂绝，重绍王位。 朝事如故，宰辅卿相，百辟臣僚，称贺泰阶，永延圣祚。 一拜 复有香积国中，被贼围逼六十日间，人民困乏，不知所计。 有一大臣，奏国王言，天尊应号有大圣力，不可思议。 王即召男官法身、女官法身，启建道场，烧香行道，礼拜天尊应号，三日三夜，精虔砺志，无倦时刻，即有五天将帅，领辖兵众，下降围绕，王国无难。 贼乃逃溃，无复叛乱。 复有贤士，入海采药，忽遇恶风，波浪震动，念诸圣号，济苦真人，将九海龙王、八风使者，摄制风水，达於彼岸。 复有女子临产，命垂顷刻。 家人乃急，请礼此圣号，立获感通，保全子母。 复有人为虎精所魅、蛟龙所魅，复有家人每至中夜，常闻音乐歌唱，龙凤变化，寻建道场，请礼经忏，凡诸精魅，悉皆沈灭。 复有男子腹如鼓大，日食其水，将及三石。 七年中间，药不能治。 复有女子日食恶草数把已来，腹中常痛，亦乃烧香供养，请礼经忏，凡被精魅，及食水草，皆礼我忏法，悉得痊愈。 其验非一，今略言之。 汝等男女，精而试之。 今日道场，礼此忏文，愿乘忏悔，克获圣果。 又愿慈尊众相圆满，法皆平等，无有高下。 普令世间四辈，一切众生，悉令清净，归依三宝法身，大慈大悲、金阙玉京、紫微上宫、寒灵丹殿，无上法王、侍忏仙真、玉童玉女、一切神仙，乘其法力，救度世间大地，一切众生。
